maml:description.maml:para: Open a source file in your preferred editor.

You can use Edit-PSFunctionInfo to open the source file for a given function with PSFunctionInfo metadata. You can either specify a loaded function by name, or pipe a Get-PSFunctionInfo expression to Edit-PSFunctionInfo. Once the function is opened in the editor, you will need to navigate to the function itself.
The editor choices are VS Code, PowerShell ISE, or Notepad. Of course they are also dependent on your operating system and if you have installed it.
The name of a loaded function, presumably with PSFunctionInfo metadata.
Specify the editor you want to use. On non-Windows systems enter the value in lower case.
The name of a loaded function, presumably with PSFunctionInfo metadata.
Specify the editor you want to use. On non-Windows systems enter the value in lower case.
Specify the path to the source file.
Specify the editor you want to use. On non-Windows systems enter the value in lower case.
The name of a loaded function, presumably with PSFunctionInfo metadata.
Specify the path to the source file.

maml:alert.maml:para: This command has an alias of epfi.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Open the source file for the Set-Title function and open in the PowerShell ISE.
Get all functions with git in the name and edit them with the default editor.

maml:description.maml:para: Get metadata for stand-alone functions.

Get-PSFunctionIfo will display function metadata that was created using New-PSFunctionInfo. The default behavior is to search loaded functions that don't belong to a module and display the custom function metadata.
As an alternative to searching items in the Function: PSDrive, you can also search .ps1 files.
Specify a tag
Specify the name of a function that doesn't belong to a module.
Specify a tag
Specify a .ps1 file to search. The command will not be able to determine if the function definition in the file has been commented out.
Specify a tag
Specify the name of a function that doesn't belong to a module.
Specify a .ps1 file to search. The command will not be able to determine if the function definition in the file has been commented out.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function has an alias of gpfi. The PSFunctionInfo object has additional named table views of source and tags.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSFunctionInfo
Name Version Alias Source ---- ------- ----- ------ prompt Get-QOTD 2.0.0 qotd C:\scripts\Get-QOTD.ps1 Get-Status 2.1.0 gst C:\scripts\getstat.ps1 Get-StatusString 1.1.0 gss C:\scripts\getstat.ps1 Convert-Expression 1.0.0 spoof C:\scripts\Convert-Expression.ps1 Add-BackupEntry 1.3.0 abe C:\scripts\PSBackup\Add-BackupEntry.ps1 Get-MyBackupFile 1.0.0 gbf C:\scripts\PSBackup\Get-MyBackupFile.ps1 ConvertTo-ASCIIArt cart Test-IsAdministrator 1.0.0 C:\Scripts\JDH-Functions.ps1 Open-VSCode 2.0.0 code C:\Scripts\JDH-Functions.ps1 ...

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSFunctionInfo -name get* | Select Name,Source
Name Source ---- ------ Get-QOTD C:\scripts\Get-QOTD.ps1 Get-Status C:\scripts\getstat.ps1 Get-UTCString C:\Scripts\JDH-Functions.ps1 Get-DiskFree C:\Scripts\JDH-Functions.ps1 Get-LastBoot C:\Scripts\JDH-Functions.ps1 Get-ModifiedFile C:\Scripts\JDH-Functions.ps1 Get-MyFunctions C:\Scripts\JDH-Functions.ps1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get function information by the function name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSFunctionInfo | Sort Source | Format-Table -View Source
Source:
Name Version Description ---- ------- ----------- tm profile-defined Hide-Git profile-defined Get-LogStamp profile-defined dt profile-defined ConvertTo-ASCIIArt profile-defined prompt
Source: C:\scripts\Convert-Expression.ps1
Name Version Description ---- ------- ----------- Convert-Expression 1.0.0 Spoof command output
Source: C:\Scripts\JDH-Functions.ps1
Name Version Description ---- ------- ----------- Get-DiskFree 1.0.0 My version of the df command Get-ModifiedFile 1.1.0 find all files of modified within a given.. Get-LastFile 2.1.0 Get files sorted by last modified date Get-LastBoot 1.0.0 Get the last boot up time ...

dev:remarks.maml:para: Use the custom table view called Source.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSFunctionInfo -Tag cim
Name Version Alias Source ---- ------- ----- ------ Get-Status 2.1.0 gst C:\scripts\getstat.ps1 Get-StatusString 1.1.0 gss C:\scripts\getstat.ps1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get functions by tag.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> get-psfunctioninfo Get-qotd | Select-Object *
Name : Get-QOTD Version : 2.0.0 Source : C:\scripts\Get-QOTD.ps1 CompanyName : JDH IT Solutions Copyright : 2020 Description : Get a quote of the day LastUpdate : 5/21/2020 5:56:01 PM Module : Path : C:\scripts\Get-QOTD.ps1 Alias : qotd Author : Jeff Guid : 16b5d672-4778-46d9-bbe5-08e7860e4e8a Tags : {Web,profile} Commandtype : Function

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all properties for a single function.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> dir C:\scripts\*.ps1 | Get-PSFunctionInfo
Name Version Alias Source ---- ------- ----- ------ Add-BackupEntry 1.0.0 abe C:\scripts\Add-BackupEntry.ps1 Get-MyFunctions 1.0.0 C:\Scripts\archived-Functions.ps1 Convert-Expression 1.0.0 spoof :\scripts\Convert-Expression.ps1 Get-LastPassItem 1.0.0 glp C:\Scripts\Get-LastPassItem.ps1 Get-QOTD 2.0.0 qotd C:\scripts\Get-QOTD.ps1 ...

dev:remarks.maml:para: Search script files for function metadata.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 7 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSFunctionInfo -Tag modules | Select-Object -property AuthorInfo
Name : Test-HelpLink Version : 0.9.0 Source : C:\scripts\update-helplinks.ps1 CompanyName : JDH IT Solutions, Inc. Copyright : (c) JDH IT Solutions, Inc. Description : Test if help file is missing the online link LastUpdate : 4/23/2021 9:21:00 AM

dev:remarks.maml:para: The PSFunctionInfo object includes a PropertySet called AuthorInfo.

maml:description.maml:para: Get defined PSFunctionInfo defaults.

You can store default values for PSFunctionInfo commands using Set-PSFunctionInfoDefaults. The data is stored in a JSON file at $home\psfunctioninfo-defaults.json. Use Get-PSFunctionInfoDefaults to view.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSFunctionInfoDefaults
Version : 0.9.0 CompanyName : JDH IT Solutions, Inc. Author : Jeffery Hicks Tags : {stand-alone} Copyright : (c) JDH IT Solutions, Inc.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of function tags.

PSFunctionInfo metadata can contain tags. Get-PSFunctionInfoTag will create a list of all tags currently in use. The tag list is built from the functions currently loaded into your PowerShell session.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-PSFunctionInfoTag backup cim console directory git powershellget profile secrets Web

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a list of current tags.

maml:description.maml:para: Create function metadata

This command will create a function metadata comment block and insert it into the source script file. Or you can copy it to the clipboard and insert it yourself. There are no commands to modify or remove the function metatdata once it has been inserted into the file. It is assumed that if you update the function, you can manually update (or remove) the metadata at the same time.

NOTE: This command will not work properly with one-line function declarations like Function Get-This { Get-Date }. It is also expected that you don't have multiple versions of the function in the same file.
Do not modify spacing or formatting of the function metadata.
Specify name of the function.
Specify the function author.
Specify a company or organization.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specify a copyright for the function.
Specify a brief function description.
Specify the path to the .ps1 file that contains the function. The path must end in .ps1.
Specify an array of optional tags.
Copy the metadata to the clipboard. The file is left untouched.
Specify a version number. It is recommended to use a standard version numbering system.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Create a backup copy of the source file before inserting the metadata comment block. The file will be created in the same directory, appending an extension of .bak1. If there are previous backups, the number will increment, i.e. .bak2. You can manually delete the backup files.
This parameter has no effect if you use -Clipboard.
Specify the function author.
Specify a company or organization.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specify a copyright for the function.
Specify a brief function description.
Specify name of the function.
Specify the path to the .ps1 file that contains the function. The path must end in .ps1.
Specify an array of optional tags.
Copy the metadata to the clipboard. The file is left untouched.
Specify a version number. It is recommended to use a standard version numbering system.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Create a backup copy of the source file before inserting the metadata comment block. The file will be created in the same directory, appending an extension of .bak1. If there are previous backups, the number will increment, i.e. .bak2. You can manually delete the backup files.
This parameter has no effect if you use -Clipboard.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function has an alias of npfi.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-PSFunctionInfo -Path c:\scripts\Test-ConsoleColors.ps1 -Description "show console color combinations" -Name Test-ConsoleColor -Author "Jeff Hicks" -CompanyName "JDH IT Solutions" -Copyright "2021 JDH IT Solutions, Inc." -Tags "scripting","console" -backup

dev:remarks.maml:para: Insert function metadata into the script file before the [cmdletbinding()] tag. This example will produce this comment block:
PSFunctionInfo
Version 1.0.0
Author Jeff Hicks
CompanyName JDH IT Solutions
Copyright 2021 JDH IT Solutions, Inc.
Description show console color combinations
Guid e07e256e-a2d6-4acc-a1cf-5d8d1be7db27
Tags scripting,console
Source C:\Scripts\Test-ConsoleColors.ps1
This example will also create a backup copy of the source file at c:\scripts\Test-ConsoleColors.ps1.bak1.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-PSFunctionInfo -Path c:\scripts\Test-ConsoleColors.ps1 -Description "show console color combinations" -Name Test-ConsoleColor -Author "Jeff Hicks" -CompanyName "JDH IT Solutions" -Copyright "2021 JDH IT Solutions, Inc." -Tags "scripting","console" -toclipboard

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will create the same metadata as the first example. Except it will be copied to the clipboard and not to the file.

maml:description.maml:para: Store default values for PSFunctionInfo commands.

Because you might define function metadata often, and want to maintain consistency, you can define a set of default values for New-PSFunctionInfo. Set-PSFunctionInfoDefaults will create a JSON file at $home\psfunctioninfo-defaults.json. When you import this module, these values will be used to define entries in $PSDefaultParameterValues. Or, run Update-PSFunctionInfoDefaults to update parameter defaults.
Enter the default author name.
Enter the default company name.
Enter the default copyright string.
Enter the default version.
Enter the default tag(s).
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Enter the default author name.
Enter the default company name.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Enter the default copyright string.
Enter the default tag(s).
Enter the default version.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-PSFunctionInfoDefaults -Copyright "(c) JDH IT Solutions, Inc." -author "Jeff Hicks" -company "JDH IT Solutions, Inc."

maml:description.maml:para: Refresh $PSDefaultParameterValues with PSFunctionInfo defaults.

You can store default values for PSFunctionInfo commands using Set-PSFunctionInfoDefaults. The data is stored in a JSON file at $home\psfunctioninfo-defaults.json. When you import the PSFunctionInfo module, this file will be imported and used to set entries in $PSDefaultParameterValues. If you modify the defaults, you can refresh your $PSDefaultParameterValues by running Update-PSFunctionInfoDefaults.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-PSFunctionInfoDefaults -author "Gladys Kravitz" PS C:\> Update-PSFunctionInfoDefaults

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example updates the default Author parameter value. The second command refreshes $PSDefaultParameterValues.
